content.raw:
Yes, the stepping is much better now. If I press the step button a few times very quickly though, the state seems to change to playing and never come back. I noticed that if I see the button changing from play to pause, then it will never go back.

I think this could be considered an edge case though, and we could tackle it in the future if you prefer.
content.html:
Yes, the stepping is much better now. If I press the step button a few times very quickly though, the state seems to change to playing and never come back. I noticed that if I see the button changing from play to pause, then it will never go back.

I think this could be considered an edge case though, and we could tackle it in the future if you prefer.

content.raw:
Cool, it steps for me now. But it seems to miss one step from time to time. See how stepping 10 steps sometimes steps 9, and stepping 1 steps sometimes steps zero:

![stepsmissing.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/345009894-stepsmissing.gif)

I also noticed that after stepping, the play button remains in play state (i.e. shows pause)
content.html:
Cool, it steps for me now. But it seems to miss one step from time to time. See how stepping 10 steps sometimes steps 9, and stepping 1 steps sometimes steps zero:

I also noticed that after stepping, the play button remains in play state (i.e. shows pause)

update.description:

update.title: Start paused

content.raw:
Stepping should work now.

RTF will remain when paused, as opposed to going to zero.  RTF is the ratio of sim-time to real-time. When paused both sim-time and real-time are static, so the real-time should be static as well and reflect the current ratio.

Now requires: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/161
content.html:
Stepping should work now.

RTF will remain when paused, as opposed to going to zero. RTF is the ratio of sim-time to real-time. When paused both sim-time and real-time are static, so the real-time should be static as well and reflect the current ratio.

Now requires: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/161

content.html: Gazebo9 maintains the last RTF, so this is inline with what gazebo does.

content.raw:
Just observed something else. While paused, if I step forward:

1. The simulation remains paused - which is ok
1. Sim time and iterations don't change - not ok
1. Real time starts running - which is inconsistent with the usual paused state
4. RTF goes to zero, instead of keeping last RTF as when you just paused
content.html:
Just observed something else. While paused, if I step forward:

  1. The simulation remains paused - which is ok
  2. Sim time and iterations don't change - not ok
  3. Real time starts running - which is inconsistent with the usual paused state
  4. RTF goes to zero, instead of keeping last RTF as when you just paused

content.raw: Ok, so now when I pause, the RTF stays the same as the last value while running. I'd expect this to be zero, but it must be because I'm used to how it works on Gazebo.
content.html: Ok, so now when I pause, the RTF stays the same as the last value while running. I'd expect this to be zero, but it must be because I'm used to how it works on Gazebo.
